article:
{{Interventions infobox | Name = | Image = GreekGravityTraction.png | Caption =
Early Greek traction device, from a Byzantine edition of Galen's work in the 2nd
century AD. | ICD10 = | ICD9 = | MeshID = D014143 | OtherCodes = | }} In
orthopedic medicine, 'traction' refers to the set of mechanisms for
straightening broken bones or relieving pressure on the spine Burke, G.L., "[http://www.macdonaldpublishing.com Backache from
Occiput to Coccyx]" and skeletal system. There are two types of traction:
skin traction and skeletal traction.
